business.headline: IT rally saves the day on Dalal Steet; Wipro, Infosys among top gainersThe biggest gainers during the session were IT stocks, with the Nifty IT index rising 2.14%, the highest among all other sectoral indices.

Budget 2025: Why financial services sector needs a 'digital lending' boostBudget 2025 would play a key role in driving the country's economic growth through enhanced credit access to the rural and underserved sectors of the economy.

TCS, Wipro, Infosys: Why IT stocks rose today despite high market volatilityIT Stocks: TCS shares were up 3.04% to Rs 4,158.45 at 3:00 pm, Wipro gained 3.37% to trade at Rs 308.40, and Infosys jumped 3.11% to Rs 1,856.70.

HDFC Bank Q3 results: Net profit rises 2.2% to Rs 16,736 croreThe private lender reported a 7.6% increase in interest earned, which came to Rs 76,007 crore compared to Rs 70,583 in the same quarter of the previous financial year.

Budget 2025: How government can provide relief to taxpayersBudget 2025 and income tax: The country's vast middle-class population is also calling for the inclusion of tax-saving provisions and deductions under the new income tax regime.

Will Donald Trump's tariff suspense hurt Indian stocks? All you need to knowDonald Trump has also threatened BRICS nations with up to 100% tariffs against taking a decision that could lead to de-dollarisation of the global economy.

Budget 2025: 3 things government should focus on to tackle climate changeBudget 2025 expectations: Experts said climate action is the need of the hour and announcements related to clean energy will be crucial. There could be a push to boost green jobs as well.

Explained: Why ICICI Prudential shares tumbled 10% after Q3 resultsICICI Prudential share price: The company's share price decline came a day after Q3FY25 results, where it reported a 43% rise in net profit to Rs 326 crore.

Zomato shares down over 23% in a month. Should you buy or avoid?Zomato share price: The food delivery giant's stock price has fallen over 14% in the previous two sessions and over 23% in the past month.

Denta Water IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPDenta Water and Infra Solutions IPO: The price band for the IPO of Denta Water has been set at Rs 279-294 per share with retail investors required to invest a minimum of Rs 14,700. The minimum lot size for an application is 50.

Sensex, Nifty open higher driven by a rally in IT sector stocks; Wipro gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 246.41 points to 76,084.77, while the NSE Nifty50 added 62.15 points to 23,086.80 as of 9:26 AM.

HDFC Bank to announce Q3 results today: Here's what to expectHDFC Bank Q3 FY25 Results Expectations: Investors will be keeping a keen eye on the results as the stock of HDFC Bank has fallen 8.62% in the last month.

Budget 2025: Raghuram Rajan says tax cuts won't solve India's fiscal problemsFormer RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said that he is not worried about the reduction in tax rates but instead about the need for more effective government spending, particularly in human capital development.

Stocks to watch today: HCLTech, HDFC Bank, HUL, Tata Communication, ZomatoHDFC Bank, Hindustan Unilever (HUL), and Tata Communication will be announcing their Q3 FY25 results today, hence their stocks will likely see some action.

Ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan speaks on Trump's tariffs, job creation and othersFormer RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan highlighted his views on issues like US President Donald Trump's plans to impose tariffs on some countries, including India, and how the economy and job creation is progressing under the Narendra Modi-led central government.

Concern for world, won't benefit US much: Raghuram Rajan on Trump tariff threatSpeaking to India Today TV, former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan warned that US President Donald Trump's tariff plans could harm global economic stability, increase costs, and deter foreign investment.
A decade of budget evolution under ModiCoalition dynamics could influence future budgetary decisions, particularly in the welfare sector. Will the government maintain its current priorities?

What to expect from Budget 2025: Growth, taxes, and fiscal realities in numbersFY25's deficit is projected at 4.9 per cent of the GDP, or Rs 16.1 trillion. Despite slower economic growth, the government is expected to stick to its fiscal discipline plan.

IMF's Gita Gopinath on Trump tariffs, impact on global growth, AI and moreDuring the interview, Gita Gopinath discussed the potential impact of US President Donald Trump's plan to impose new trade tariffs, global growth, bilateral trade between India and America, cryptocurrency and more.

IMF's Gita Gopinath suggests India to lower tariffs and focus on domestic reformsGita Gopinath suggested that India should consider lowering its tariffs, not only to counter the tariff concerns raised by former US President Donald Trump, but also to boost its own economic growth.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Can't blame Bangladesh: Farooq Abdullah on nationality of Saif Ali Khan's attackerThe suspect arrested in the Saif Ali Khan stabbing case had entered India illegally from Bangladesh. Farooq Abdullah contended that an entire nation can't be blamed for one attack and went on to draw the analogy of Indians migrating to the US.

CBI can, not state: Agency opposes Bengal's plea against life term in RG Kar caseThe Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Wednesday opposed the West Bengal government's appeal before the Calcutta High Court against the life imprisonment sentence to Sanjay Roy, who was convicted of the rape and murder of a trainee doctor at RG Kar hospital in Kolkata last year.

Saif hugs auto driver who took him to hospital, mother Sharmila blesses himSaif Ali Khan met the auto driver who took him to the hospital following the knife attack on January 16. The actor's mother, Sharmila Tagore, thanked him.

Chaos in lives of Indians on H-1B, L1 visas, their children in US. Here's whyThe lives of thousands of Indians and their families in the US on work visas like L1 and H-1B are going to witness a big change. As President Donald Trump orders cancellation of birthright citizenship, the children of Indians on work permits and in Green Card queues are going to be hit. Either they have to self-deport, or take up visas.

Paatal Lok is a stunner, and a rarity that gets Nagaland and Nagas rightPaatal Lok Season 2: By weaving Nagaland's cultural nuances and history into a gripping narrative, Prime Video series Pataal Lok Season 2, achieves a rare first. It shatters stereotypes and avoids the northeast exoticism trap. With breathtaking visuals and sensitive storytelling, Paatal Lok Season 2 has set a benchmark for mainstream portrayals of the northeast region of India.

Day 11 Live Updates: Jannik Sinner wins second set vs Alex de MinaurAustralian Open Day 11 Live Updates: Jannik Sinner has won the second set against Alex de Minaur in the quarterfinal clash at Rod Laver Arena. Ben Shelton defeated Lorenzo Sonego and advanced to the semi-final of the hard court major. Earlier, Iga Swiatek sealed her spot in the semi-final after a thumping win over Emma Navarro in the quarter-final and Madison Keys completed a comeback win over Elina Svitolina.

Prince Harry settles long-running lawsuit with Rupert Murdoch's media group Prince Harry was suing the publisher of the Sun alleging NGN unlawfully obtained private information about him from 1996 until 2011.

Trump's threat fuelling Trudeau's trouble? Survey says Canadians want polls nowWhile Donald Trump is busy signing executive orders, one of which threatened a 25% tariff on goods from Canada, pressure might be mounting for Justin Trudeau as a poll revealed that most Canadians want an immediate federal election.

Maha Kumbh mela from space: Isro's before-and-after images capture grandeurMaha Kumbh: Isro images show a massive infrastructure made at Prayagraj's Maha Kumbh Mela site where 400 million people from across the world are expected to gather.
Pakistani designer Deepak Perwani says life in India is better, goes viralPakistani designer Deepak Perwani's remarks comparing his country to India have gone viral on social media.

JDU doesn't support BJP government in Manipur: The curious case of a reminderJD(U) on Wednesday reiterated its withdrawal of support to the BJP-led Manipur government. However, the move doesn't impact the N Biren Singh-led government in the state as the BJP currently has 37 legislators in the 60-member Manipur Assembly.

AAP's 'middle class manifesto' lists 7 demands from CentreAAP chief Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday unveiled his party's manifesto for the upcoming Delhi elections, for the middle class, a section he claims has been ignored by successive governments.

Shashi Kapoor's grandson Zahaan says 'proud of the family I come from but...'Zahaan Kapoor, grandson of Shashi Kapoor, plays the lead role in Netflix's Black Warrant. In an exclusive interview, the actor spoke about his approach to navigating the weight of his legacy and determination to establish his own identity in the entertainment industry.

Budget 2025: How government can provide relief to taxpayersBudget 2025 and income tax: The country's vast middle-class population is also calling for the inclusion of tax-saving provisions and deductions under the new income tax regime.

Who is Shivon Zilis, Elon Musk's 'mystery partner' spotted at Trump's dinner?Elon Musk was accompanied by his 'mystery partner' at the pre-inauguration dinner of Donald Trump, making many wonder if he was making his relationship official with her. The woman is Shivon Zilis who shares three children with him.

Why Chandrababu Naidu is likely to ignore calls to elevate Nara LokeshAmidst calls for Nara Lokesh to be elevated as Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister, the dynamics within the TDP-led coalition government, which is carefully balanced by Jana Sena Chief Pawan Kalyan's pivotal role, could face potential disruption.

Nita Ambani flaunts ethnic glam in traditional sarees at Trump's inauguration eventsMukesh and Nita Ambani attended Donald Trump's Inauguration Day ceremonies in Washington, where the latter proudly showcased her Indian heritage through her sartorial choices.

Pataudi family may lose property worth Rs 15,000 crore after court orderOn December 13, 2024, the Madhya Pradesh High Court asked the Pataudi family to present their side before the appellate authority in 30 days. As of January 21, however, it was not clear whether the family did so.

Video: Car crashes through wall, falls from first floor parking of Pune apartmentThe car fell from the first-floor parking area after the driver accidentally engaged the reverse gear, losing control of the vehicle.

Have mercy on them Mr President: Why video of bishop's appeal is going viral Shortly after he took office, Trump announced that he would bring sweeping changes to the "gender identity" policy and also signed an executive order to launch an immediate crackdown on illegal immigration.

Justin Bieber says 'someone unfollowed' Hailey from his account, later deletes postSinger Justin Bieber denied unfollowing wife Hailey Bieber on Instagram. In a now-deleted post, he claimed that 'someone went on his account and unfollowed her'.

Top court's split verdict for Delhi riots accused bail plea for poll campaigningThe Supreme Court on Wednesday pronounced a split verdict on the petition filed by Delhi riots case accused Tahir Hussain seeking interim bail to campaign for the Delhi Assembly elections.

We need great people to come to US: Trump weighs in on H-1B visa debateDonald Trump on H-1B visa: When asked about the H-1B visa debate at a press conference on Tuesday, President Trump said that "I like both sides of the argument, but I also like very competent people coming into our country, even if that involves them training and helping other people that may not have the qualifications they do".

Director Gautham Menon regrets doing Dhanush's Enai Noki Paayum ThotaDirector Gautham Menon, in a recent interview, said that Dhanush's Enai Noki Paayum Thota is the only film he regrets making. He said that he has been joking about it in his recent interviews.
Watch: Salman Khan rides in kaali peeli taxi as he shoots for Sikandar in MumbaiSaman Khan's video from Sikandar sets has gone viral. The actor is currently shooting in Mumbai.

Director Chris Columbus feels Cillian Murphy will be 'amazing' as VoldemortDirector of the first and second part of Harry Potter film franchise, Chris Columbus, expressed his support for Cillian Murphy as Lord Voldemort for the TV series. He also shared his excitement for the series, calling the idea 'spectacular'.

Justin Bieber says 'someone unfollowed' Hailey from his account, later deletes postSinger Justin Bieber denied unfollowing wife Hailey Bieber on Instagram. In a now-deleted post, he claimed that 'someone went on his account and unfollowed her'.

sports.headline: Rishabh Pant vs Ravindra Jadeja in Ranji Trophy as Saurashtra host DelhiThe Delhi vs Saurashtra Ranji Trophy match will feature an interesting battle between wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant and all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja.

Ireland knock shoddy Pakistan out of U19 Women's T20 World CupU19 Women's T20 World Cup 2025: Niamh MacNulty's Ireland beat Komal Khan's Pakistan by 13 runs (DLS) and made their way through to the Super Sixes. Pakistan failed to win a single match in the group stage.

Rohit Sharma's Ranji return: When and where to watch Mumbai vs Jammu and KashmirRohit Sharma returns to Ranji Trophy after nearly a decade. The India Test and ODI captain will be playing against Jammu and Kashmir with the match starting on January 23. Here's where you can watch Mumbai's Ranji Trophy game against J&K.

Hungry Rohit Sharma will get a big one on Ranji Trophy return: Ajinkya Rahane Ranji Trophy 2025: Mumbai captain Ajinkya Rahane said Rohit Sharma looked relaxed in the lead-up to his red-ball return, backing the Indian skipper to get a big one in the upcoming fixture against Jammu and Kashhmir. Rohit will play Ranji Trophy for the first time since 2015.

Watch: Bangladesh women dance in joy after historic win vs West IndiesBangladesh took a step closer towards qualifying for the ODI World Cup next year after their maiden win over West Indies in international cricket. On Tuesday, Nigar Sultana Joty and Co. won the second ODI by 60 runs at the Warner Park.

Ben Shelton fights past Lorenzo Sonego to book maiden semi-final spotAustralian Open 2025: Ben Shelton advanced to the semi-final of the hard court major after beating Lorenzo Sonego 6-4, 7-5, 4-6, 7-6 (7-4) at the Rod Laver Arena on Wednesday.

AB de Villiers hints at comeback: Not talking about RCB, no serious stuffFormer South African captain AB de Villiers said he is tempted to play competitive cricket, but ruled out returning to professional leagues like the IPL or SA20. De Villiers retired from professional cricket after the IPL 2021 season.

Amorim unleashed rage on Manchester United players, shattered TV: ReportsRuben Amorim's fiery outburst following Manchester United's 3-1 loss to Brighton left players reeling and raised concerns over squad attitude.

Laura Mueller becomes first female Race Engineer in Formula 1 history Laura Mueller has become the first female Race Engineer in Formula 1 history after Haas promoted her. She will be the primary radio contact for Esteban Ocon, who will make his maiden appearance for Haas.

MI Cape Town inch closer to maiden playoffs spot after washout vs Durban SGMI Cape Town moved closer to the Betway SA20 playoffs after rain abandoned their clash against Durban's Super Giants, earning two crucial points. Meanwhile, DSG face a must-win situation in their remaining games to keep their hopes alive.

Watch: Buttler gives autograph to fan on wheelchair ahead of T20I vs IndiaJos Buttler won hearts in Kolkata by signing a bat for specially abled Indian fan Dharamveer Pal, ahead of England's T20I opener against India, showcasing his connection with fans off the field.

On India return, Mohammed Shami eyes Kapil Dev's record IND vs ENG: Indian fast bowler Mohammed Shami is on the cusp of a major landmark in international as he makes his return in the upcoming T20I series against England, starting January 22 in Kolkata.

Dravid has been my idol, happy to have worn his jersey No.19: Niki PrasadU19 Women's T20 World Cup 2025: Indian U19 skipper Niki Prasad opened up on her admiration for Rahul Dravid and how his batting has inspired her since childhood. Under Niki, India have won both their matches and are placed on top of Group A.

India coach Gautam Gambhir visits Kalighat temple ahead of first T20I vs EnglandGautam Gambhir visited Kolkata's iconic Kalighat Kali Temple, seeking blessings before India's T20I series against England. With Mohammed Shami's return and Champions Trophy preparations in focus, India eyes redemption following their recent struggles against Australia.

Alex Hartley receives 'cold shoulder' from England after fitness commentAlex Hartley has disclosed being given the cold shoulder by England players during the Women's Ashes after criticising the team's fitness issues following their early T20 World Cup exit, raising questions about accountability in women's cricket.

Kohli, Rohit's form important for India to win in Dubai: KaifMohammad Kaif believes Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's experience and batting prowess will be crucial for India's success in the Champions Trophy, urging fans to trust their ability to bounce back from recent struggles and deliver on the big stage.

1st T20I, Predicted XI: Will dew affect India's team combination in Kolkata?India vs England, 1st T20I: India are set to kick off their T20I series against England on Wednesday in Kolkata. With dew expected to fall during the second half of the match, team selection will be crucial for both teams.

Liverpool, Barcelona into UCL last 16, Atletico stun LeverkusenBarcelona and Liverpool secured thrilling Champions League Round of 16 spots with dramatic victories, as Raphinha's late heroics sealed Barcelona's 5-4 win over Benfica, while Mohamed Salah's milestone goal led Liverpool to a hard-fought 2-1 triumph over Lille.

Shami, Gambhir-McCullum tussle in focus in battle of powerhousesIndia vs England 1st T20I: India will be keen to see returning pacer Mohammed Shami's fitness when a power-packed India take on a dynamic England in the first T20I at the high-scoring Eden Gardens.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
